Query: How to get ip address of a server on Centos 7 in bash

Answers.MP Summary: send ICMP ECHO_REQUEST to network hosts
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_954074: now unable to get IP address from DHCP on modem - what changed?
so_25790412: Efficient way to get ip addresses based on a list of hostnames
Top-3 Scripts:
au_954074: ping [-c count] [-M do] [-s packet_size] [host]

ping -c 4 -M do -s 1472 8.8.8.8 # this will probably show fragmentation

ping -c 4 -M do -s 1462 8.8.8.8 # may show fragmentation

ping -c 4 -M do -s 1452 8.8.8.8 # no fragmentation?

ping -c 4 -M do -s 1453 8.8.8.8 # still no fragmentation?

so_25790412: parallel -a hosts 'echo -n {}; ping -c1 {} |egrep -o -m 1 "\([0-9]+\.[^\(\r\n]*\)"'

for h in virgin router; do 
   echo $h; 
done | parallel 'echo -n {}; ping -c1 {} |egrep -o -m 1 "\([0-9]+\.[^\(\r\n]*\)"'

Explanations about Options.-s:
Specifies the number of data bytes to be sent. The default is 56, which translates
 into 64 ICMP data bytes when combined with the 8 bytes of ICMP header data.
Explanations about Options.-M:
Select Path MTU Discovery strategy. pmtudisc_option may be either do (prohibit
 fragmentation, even local one), want (do PMTU discovery, fragment locally when packet
 size is large), or dont (do not set DF flag).
Explanations about Options.-c:
Stop after sending count ECHO_REQUEST packets. With deadline option, ping waits for
 count ECHO_REPLY packets, until the timeout expires.

Answers.MP Summary: show or set the system's host name
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_23271599: how to get ip address of localhost

Explanations about Options.-i:
Display the network address(es) of the host name. Note that this works only if the
 host name can be resolved. Avoid using this option; use hostname --all-ip-addresses
 instead.
